TITLE.P: Transport of Pupils with Additional Support Needs 2018-2021 List 1

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Council requires to put in place, a multi-lot contract for the transport of school pupils with Additional Support Needs (ASN) with a single supplier per Lot. The services run during the Councils school term time only.
All drivers must be fully licensed and insured, and will be required to provide evidence of valid vehicle/driver documentation which includes vehicle MOT, road tax and Driving licence.
Some contracts may have a requirement for an escort; escorts should be arranged by the tenderer.
All drivers and any escorts must be PVG (Protection of Vulnerable Groups) registered and approved.

— For ease of reference to potential providers, rather than outline Approx 180 Lots in the contract notice, the Council has provided the full details of the individual contracts/lots as a separate file (Ms Excel spreadsheet format) which is attached to this contract noticE. Please refer to document "Schedule of Contracts 2018-2021".

MAIN_SITE.P: All Contracts/Lots will be within and bordering North Lanarkshire area. Please refer to the Schedule of Contracts 2018-2021.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The individual Contract/Lot requirements are detailed within the Schedule of Contracts 2018-2021.

Each Contract/Lot is to provide transport to and from school for the routes stated. It is estimated that the contracts from this tender exercise will be for periods of up to three (3) years, for the Council’s school term time, August 2018 until June 2021. During the course of this contract there can be no guarantees regarding the life span of any individual contract as each is dependent on person circumstances.
Potential providers may bid for one or more Contract/Lot.

Potential providers can combine two or more lots. It should be noted that the decision to accept combined bids is at the discretion of the Council who take into consideration the needs of the pupils involved including the length of the journey and the value of the bid compared to the value of other combined or individual bids received. Potential providers bidding for combined Lots are encouraged to bid for the individual lots as there is no certainty a combined lot proposal will be suitable for the individual pupils.
As identified in the Schedule of Contracts, some Contracts/Lots require specific vehicle specifications i.e. wheelchair use to accommodate the child’s needs.
As identified in the Schedule of Contracts, some contracts/lots require an Escort. Escorts should be arranged by the Tenderer with cost of the Escort fully included in the Pricing Schedule.
All Contracts/Lots must be carried out in accordance with: the ITT; the ASN Special Conditions of Contract; and, the Councils General Conditions of Contract. Please refer to Notice attachments.

Potential providers will be required to provide documentary evidence to the Council for: All Insurances specified in the ITT; PVG disclosure for driver(s) and escort(s); and, All vehicle/driver documentation, including Current MOT, Road tax and Driving licence.
During the course of this contract there can be no guarantees regarding the life span of any individual contract as each is dependent on the individual pupil circumstances.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: 4B.5.1 It is a requirement of this contract that bidders hold, or can commit to obtain prior to the commence of any subsequently awarded contract, the types and levels of insurance indicated below:
Tenderers must complete the ITT Response Document 3 — ESPD (Scotland Response). This criteria is located in Part IV: Selection criteria, Questions 4B.5.1 and 4B.5.2.
A pass will be achieved for affirmative responses = 'Yes, I already have this' or 'No, but I commit to obtain it' or 'Not applicable — my business is exempt'.
A fail will be a response = 'no, and I cannot commit to obtain it'.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: 4C.9 Bidders will be required to demonstrate that they have (or have access to) the relevant tools, plant or technical equipment to deliver the types of requirements detailed in II.2.4 in the OJEU Contract Notice or the relevant section of the Site Notice.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: A pass will be demonstration of suitable vehicle supported with compliant vehicle and driver documentation in order to carry out the requirements as specified in the Contract notice and ITT.
Please respond to the question in the ESPD document by providing your capacity to accept contracts i.e. the number of vehicles you have available to undertake contracts.
In addition please provide details of the type of vehicles(s) you have available e.g. wheelchair accessible, saloon etc.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: Conditions of Contracts require the bidder to be able to provide documentary evidence to the Council for: All Insurances specified; PVG disclosure for driver(s) and escort(s); and, All vehicle/driver documentation, including Current MOT, Road tax and Driving Licence.

INFO_ADD.P: The Invitation to tender and supporting documentation may be accessed and downloaded from the Public Contracts Scotland Portal at http//www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk
To access these documents Tenderers will firstly need to register (if they have not already done so) on the Public Contracts Scotland Portal and then express interest in this particular procurement.
Tenders must be returned in hard copy only by the date and time specified in this Contract notice and also stated within the ITT. Late tenders will not be accepted.

The council reserves the right not to award any contract as a result of the procurement process initiated by this Contract Notice and in such event will not be liable for any costs incurred by any party.

Note: To register your interest in this notice and obtain any additional information please visit the Public Contracts Scotland Web Site at http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/Search/Search_Switch.aspx?ID=538488

The Contracting Authority does not intend to include a sub-contract clause as part of community benefits (as per Section 25 of the Procurement Reform (Scotland) Act 2014) in this contract for the following reason:

The overall Contract notice is for an aggregation of approximately 180 individual Lots. Each individual lot is relatively small value and in the main a high proportion of Lots are awarded to micro-business and self-employed drivers.
The Contracting Authority does not intend to include any community benefit requirements in this contract for the following reason:

The overall Contract notice is for an aggregation of approximately 180 individual Lots. Each individual lot is relatively small value and in the main a high proportion of Lots are awarded to micro-business and self-employed drivers. There are no specific community benefits clause associated to the award of these lots.
